item.title: By: AS
item.dc:creator: AS
item.description:
Q: “What if it is New Year’s Eve and a non-Jewish girl sits on your lap with a bottle of non-kosher champagne and says lets have some fun?"
A: Call Rabbi B. and ask ask about the permissibility of Stam Yayyin B'sha'at HaD'chak?
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: H Sragow
item.dc:creator: H Sragow
item.description:
Re: "A non-Jewish girl sits on your lap."
Walter Wurzburger often used such hypotheticals during his Ethics classes (although to my memory, it was usually "A lovely Stern girl sits on your lap"). It's nice to know some people were listening.
